column4: hello can  i ask for some help in here about installing wireless
as long as its under ubuntu, yes
what wifi chip are you using?
still doesn't tell us the wifi chip
then why are you reaching for ndisgtk, there may be a native driver!
why would you want or need to if there is a Linux driver for it for Linux. Why would you need to bother
if you run:  sudo lshw -C network      you should see what wifi chip it is
yes, but what is the product line
press CTRL+ALT+T and run:  sudo lshw -C network
ok and run:  lspci    one line will identify the device
try:   sudo modprobe r816
wait, that's an ethernet controller, not wireless
yes but the wifi is having the issue...
can you run:  lspci -n; lsb_release -a; uname -a     and go to http://pastie.org  and put all the text there
we don't know the wifi chip, so it may not be needed
once you hit paste, copy the new address in the address bar and paste the URL here
http://askubuntu.com/questions/139632/wireless-card-realtek-rtl8723ae-bt-is-not-recognized
https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/gnome-nettool/+question/205818
don't you think you should get something a bit more fundamental setup, like your wireless connectivity....
while you read, run:  sudo apt-get install arduino
all ok now?
wifi all working?
the modprobe command will succeed (no output)
you don't need the .inf
